ygData.messageBody:
Well, from what I've seen before, Verant thinks all the classes are
balanced. That is, until a couple hundred players complain about their
class. Given that not many play a Shadow Knight, one can clearly see that
there is no incentive for Verant to change this class. Nevertheless, I
believe that a few things should change in order to bring balance to the
Shadow Knight class:

- Paladin's Lay Hands become ((level x 10) + 1) - just like the HT
- Lay Hands will sometimes heal the enemy - to compensate the resistability
of HT
- Paladin's Healing series become the Summon Water series - to compensate
for the SK's lack of healing spells
- Paladins, however, get Minor Healing at level 30 - to balance out the
randomness and 'usefulness' of Vampiric Embrace

Now, the above will bring balance between the Paladin and the Shadow Knight.
I won't even go into why Shamans, Druids and Necros (with Jboots) are too
powerful. I've seen the same level Shaman and Druid soloing Cyclops when I
can hardly put a dent in them. Even with Pet, HT, going oom and the a good
weapon, I can hardly take off 50% of it's life before having to zone. Now
that Verant is increasing the speed of DoT, it makes Shamans and Necros
leaps ahead of Shadow Knights. But I'm used to that - all I want is to bring
balance between the SK and the Paladin.

Note - I believe I posted the wrong info about the Vampiric Embrace the
other day. It is not (12 + (2/2 levels beyond 22)); rather, I found out that
it is something much less. Does anyone have the correct formula for the VM?
